model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!

MEMORY:
Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking as free activities, which is why they have planned several camping trips for the summer and will be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: I loaded up on repellent like you said and I also grabbed a few of those mosquito repellent bracelets, I figured why not!
memory_text: Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking as free activities, which is why they have planned several camping trips for the summer and will be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail.
speaker: Speaker B
raw_prediction: Sounds like you're all set for your camping trips! Have you checked the weather forecast for those days?
prediction:
OUTPUT:

Brief explanation: The MEMORY informs us that Speaker A enjoys camping and hiking and has planned several camping trips for the summer, which provides context for why they are discussing mosquito repellent. This background information is helpful for Speaker B to generate a response relevant to camping and hiking.

Judgement: "Yes"
